message:
If `SynchronizationContext.Current == null` and `TaskScheduler.Current == TaskScheduler.Default`, then you have no context.

> In my current project I have full .net on service fabric for example with many ConfigureAwait(false) with looks bad and I wonder in light of our conversation if I can delete this code and behavior will be the same?

I believe it's best to leave the `ConfigureAwait(false)` in place. Even if your code doesn't need it now, it makes the code more reusable.
